<h1 align="center">Tianjin University E-card Automated Inquiry Tool</h1>
<p align="center">
  <a>This tool automatically checks your dorm's electricity balance and sends an email reminder when it falls below a set threshold, preventing sudden power outages due to missed payments.</a>
</p>

## ‚≠ê Key Features

üîç Automated electricity bill inquiry.

üì© Sends email reminders when the balance is low.

üëç Cross-platform support (Windows, Linux, macOS).

‚è∞ Automatically sets up a daily scheduled task to check the balance.

üîë Passwords and email authorization codes are encrypted and stored locally for security.

## üíª Requirements

### ‚öô System

| Operating System    | Supported Architectures                |
| ------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| Windows 10 or later | x86_64                                 |
| Ubuntu 22.04 or later | x86_64, x86, arm64, arm32v7             |
| macOS 12 or later   | x86_64 (Intel), arm64 (Apple Silicon) |

> ‚ö† Other Linux distributions are not verified and may not work correctly. Support for non-Debian based distributions is planned for the future.

### üì´ Email

Currently supports QQ Mail, 163 Mail, and TJU Mail (SMTP).

### üõú Network

- Connected to the Tianjin University campus network.
- Ability to send emails.

## üöÄ Quick Start

### 1Ô∏è‚É£ Download the Program

- **Windows users:** Click "[here](https://gitee.com/ibenzene/TJUEcard/releases/download/v0.1.5/TJUEcard-windows-x86_64-v0.1.5.zip)" to download the zip file. After extracting, you will find `TJUEcard.exe` and `TJUEcardSetup.exe`. **Please place these two executable files in the folder where you want to install them and do not move them later.**

- **Linux or macOS users:** Open a terminal and run the following command for one-click installation:

    ```bash
    curl -fsSLO https://gitee.com/ibenzene/TJUEcard/raw/master/install_TJUEcard.sh && sudo bash install_TJUEcard.sh && rm -f install_TJUEcard.sh
    ```

### 2Ô∏è‚É£ Configure the Program

> üí° **Windows users:** If you need to configure a scheduled task, please right-click and run `TJUEcardSetup.exe` as **administrator**. This is safe; administrator privileges are only used to ensure the scheduled task can run even when the screen is locked.
>
> ‚ùì If you are unsure of your e-card account password, please "[verify or retrieve it](https://github.com/iBUHub/TJUEcard/issues/3)".

When you run `TJUEcardSetup`, the program will guide you through the configuration, including setting your **e-card username**, **e-card password**, and the email and authorization code for receiving notifications.

After successful configuration, a `TJUEcard_user_config.json` configuration file will be generated in the same directory as the program. The program will then ask if you want to automatically set up a system scheduled task. This task will run the `TJUEcard` program at a fixed time every day to check the electricity balance and send an email. The fixed time will be the time you last completed the configuration by running the `TJUEcardSetup` program.

### üëÄ Important Notes

#### üë§ Account Information

- This project requires your Tianjin University e-card account and password to log in and check the electricity bill. This information is stored on your computer and will not be uploaded to any server.
- The same account can only be logged in on one computer at a time. Do not use the same account when running `TJUEcardSetup` on multiple computers.
- Re-running `TJUEcardSetup` will automatically overwrite the previous configuration. To reconfigure your user password, email, or room number, please run `TJUEcardSetup` again.

#### ‚è∞ Scheduled Tasks

- The execution time of the scheduled task is determined by the time you run the `TJUEcardSetup` program, and it runs once a day at that set time.
- If you move the program's location or change its file name, the scheduled task may fail. You will need to run `TJUEcardSetup` again to reconfigure it or manually modify the scheduled task's configuration file.

## üôã FAQ

**Q: Where is the scheduled task installed? How can I manage it?**

A: Please refer to the "[Scheduled Task Management](https://github.com/iBUHub/TJUEcard/issues/4)" documentation for advanced operations.

**Q: Will the program run in the background all the time?**

A: No. The program only runs when triggered by the scheduled task and does not stay in the background or continuously consume system resources.

**Q: What should I do if the scheduled task does not run?**

A: If you are a Windows or Linux user, please check the "[Scheduled Task Management](https://github.com/iBUHub/TJUEcard/issues/4)" and the `TJUEcard.log` file. If you are a macOS user, please use the `mail` command to check the logs delivered by cron.

**Q: Why am I not receiving emails?**

A: Please check if your email configuration is correct, or if the email has been delivered to your spam folder. You can also check the `TJUEcard.log` file for more details.

**Q: What should I do if the program has issues?**

A: Please create a new [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/iBUHub/TJUEcard/issues/new) describing your problem and attach detailed error information.

## ü§ù Contributing

We welcome all forms of contributions! If you have good ideas or needs, feel free to participate in the project in the following ways:

- **Submit a Pull Request:** If you have fixed a bug or implemented a new feature, feel free to submit a PR.
- **Create an Issue:** If you have any suggestions or find a problem, please discuss it on the [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/iBUHub/TJUEcard/issues) page.
- **Participate in Development:** If you are interested in the development of the project, please contact us by email: [hello@ibuhub.com](mailto:hello@ibuhub.com).

## üìã To-Do

- [ ] The scheduled task on macOS has issues; the fix time is to be determined.
- [ ] Consider supporting multi-room inquiries.
- [ ] For user convenience, the next major version will launch a centralized query service, **where users only need to provide the room number and email to get daily inquiries**.
